intro: Alsine geniculata var. bartollotae, commonly known as the Bartollot's alsine, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water in harsh conditions. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
